It was the day after Akane and Inori came to stay\nat Tsubaki Apartments.%K%P
Taking a deep breath of the refreshing morning air,\nI walked along the corridor toward the living room.%K%P
A lot had happened over the last 24 hours, but I'd\nslept like a log and felt much better now.%K%P
This time yesterday I'd never have imagined a couple\nof goddesses would be moving in with me.%K%P
Whatever the reason, though, I was glad to have\nsome new residents around, like in the old days.%K%P
'Can't let myself get carried away, though...'%K%P
From this day on, the future of Tsubaki was in\nmy hands.%K%P
I'd have to stay focused if I was going to get\nthis right.%K%P
'I'll find a way to save this place, I know it.'%K%P
I gave my cheeks a quick slap to drive away the\nlast of my early-morning daze.%K%P
'Okay, let's do this.'%K%P
Bracing myself, I opened the door to the\nliving room.%K%P
'Good morning.'%K%P
Inori was already there, holding her head in\nfrustration for some reason.%K%P
'Oh... Good morning, Sho.'%K%P
She seemed downhearted.%K%P
'Hey, is something wrong?'%K%P
'I suppose you could say that... Just take a look.'%K%P
I followed Inori's gaze and saw Akane sprawled\non the floor watching TV.%K%P
'Hm? Oh, hi Sho.'%K%P
She dimly registered my presence and gave a\nhalf-hearted wave.%K%P
'Morning, Akane.'%K%P
'Mornin'...'%K%P
Akane replied in a sleepy tone of voice,\nmaking no move to get up.%K%P
She sounded like she was ready to go back\nto bed at a moment's notice.%K%P
I couldn't sense even the slightest trace\nof vitality from her.%K%P
'Guess you're not a morning person, huh?'%K%P
That explained Inori's exasperation.%K%P
'Rise and shine, Akane. You can't spend all day\ndown there.'%K%P
'Awww, come ooon, it's still early...\nFive more minutes...?'%K%P
'Don't be like that. Today's the day we start getting\nyour life back on track.'%K%P
'Oh yeah... We're really doing that, huh...'%K%P
'We've got plenty of time.\nNo need to dive right into it.'%K%P
Akane was already trying to wriggle out of the plan.\nI can't say I was surprised.%K%P
'Just when are you planning to start applying\nyourself, Akane?'%K%P
'When I feel like it.\nCould be today, could be tomorrow.\n'Goddess only knows,' as they say.'%K%P
'Please take this seriously...'%K%P
'Nuh uh. I'm not up for it right now.'%K%P
Akane stuck to the floor and continued to refuse\nto do anything even vaguely responsible.%K%P
This was going to harder than I thought.%K%P
'Get yourself together, Akane!\nThis is important!'%K%P
'Too bad, I'm busy! I'm gonna spend this whole\nday taking it easy.'%K%P
No matter how hard Inori tried, Akane continued to\nresist any calls to action.%K%P
At this rate, our rehabilitation scheme would be\nover before it even began.%K%P
I tried taking a more firm approach.%K%P
'So, Akane... You're okay with becoming a spirit,\nthen?'%K%P
'Hmm, I thought about it, and if that's how things\nturn out...that's just how it goes, right?'%K%P
Even my appeal to her sense of\nself-preservation fell on deaf ears.\nThat was some next-level laziness.%K%P
What was I supposed to do now?%K%P
'Everyone, breakfast is ready!'%K%P
Maika's voice dispersed the gloom that had\nsettled over us.%K%P
'Yay, food! I'm starving! Inori's had me up since\nthe crack of dawn!'%K%P
Akane leaped to her feet and dashed out of the room,\nher eyes sparkling with glee.%K%P
'Whoa! Hey, Akane!'%K%P
The conversation broke up without us\naccomplishing anything.%K%P
'Good heavens... If Akane's going to be like this,\nI don't know if rehabilitating her will even\nbe possible.'%K%P
'Don't get so down. It's still only the first day,\nand you've got me here to help.'%K%P
Inori looked a little happier when she heard that.%K%P
'Thank you... You're right, it's too early to\ngive up now!'%K%P
'That's the spirit!'%K%P
Inori and I headed for the dining table with fresh\ndetermination.%K%P
'I'd like to call this meeting to order.'%K%P
Breakfast was over and Maika had gone out\non some errand.%K%P
That left me and Inori to discuss possible\nstrategies, while Akane returned to her spot\nin front of the TV.%K%P
'First and foremost, we've got to find a way to\nmotivate Akane. We won't get anywhere if she\ndoesn't want to cooperate.'%K%P
Right now Akane's attitude was the biggest\nobstacle to her rehabilitation.%K%P
If we could just convince her to be a little more\nproactive, perhaps the rest would start\nfalling into place.%K%P
'I agree, but just how do we get started?'%K%P
'Let me ask you this, what are we aiming for when\nwe talk about reforming Akane? How would we know\nwhen we were done?'%K%P
Words like 'rehabilitation' weren't a lot of help for\nvisualizing a specific goal.%K%P
From where I was standing, we had nowhere near\nenough time to get Akane to act more like\nother goddesses.%K%P
'Hmm... At the very least, she should be able to\nstop her Jinriki from going haywire.'%K%P
'That would mean these blackouts would stop,\nand she'd be causing much less trouble for the people\nof this town.'%K%P
'How exactly would we get her to restrain\nher powers?'%K%P
'Akane's powers are rooted in her emotions.'%K%P
'If she can learn to control her feelings better,\nthat would be a start.'%K%P
Emotional restraint, huh?%K%P
That didn't sound like something we could achieve\nin such a short time.%K%P
There was another issue, too.%K%P
'I'd like to avoid bullying her into it.\nIs that okay?'%K%P
'Naturally.\nIt wouldn't be true rehabilitation\nif we forced it.'%K%P
'I don't want Akane to obey my every instruction,\nI'd just like her to be more aware of her\nresponsibilities.'%K%P
That sounded reasonable to me.%K%P
It wouldn't be right to ignore her feelings\non the matter.%K%P
We were left with the question of how to get Akane\nto apply herself while still respecting her\nfree-spirited nature.%K%P
'I'm drawing a blank...'%K%P
'Same here...'%K%P
Inori and I discussed things for a little longer,\nbut neither of us could come up with a\nrealistic plan.%K%P
Just as we were reaching the end of our rope,\nAkane suddenly turned up the volume\nof the show she was watching.%K%P
'Next up, we have a feature on an\nup-and-coming Divine Idol!'%K%P
'A Divine Idol?'%K%P
The screen showed footage of a popular young singer\non her nationwide tour.%K%P
'Oh, yeah, I've heard of this girl.'%K%P
Everyone was talking about Divine Idols these days.%K%P
They sang, they danced, they did everything.\nMaika had been telling me about them the other day.%K%P
'Idol...? Oh yes,\nquite a few goddesses seem to be\ndoing that kind of job.'%K%P
The goddess in the video stood on a shining stage,\nclad in a beautiful frilly outfit with a\ncheck design.%K%P
Her performance was breathtaking, packed with\notherworldly effects created by her Jinriki.%K%P
'That looks like so much fun...\nIt's kinda too bad I can't do\nanything like that...%K%P
'Are you a fan, Akane?'%K%P
'I'm just a little curious... I wonder what it's\nlike to have that many followers.'%K%P
I looked back at the TV.\nThe camera had swung around\nto show the concert audience.%K%P
Men and women, young and old, all kinds of people\nwere there, cheering frantically.%K%P
Between songs, they waved and chanted the idol's\nname, all competing for a chance to be noticed.%K%P
Even watching it on the TV like this I could feel all\nthe excitement as if I was really there.%K%P
'Wait a minute...'%K%P
As we watched the concert, an idea started\nto take form.%K%P
What if we tried to make Akane an idol?%K%P
She obviously liked that kind of thing.\nMaybe this could be the key to motivating her.%K%P
A local idol would benefit the community, too.\nThat sounded like something Inori's superiors\nwould approve of.%K%P
Plus, it might teach Akane some self control,\nmeaning less blackouts.%K%P
We didn't have any other plans at the moment.\nI could at least suggest it.%K%P
'Say, Akane?'%K%P
'Hm? Yeah?'%K%P
'If you're interested...why don't you try becoming\nan idol yourself?'%K%P
'Huh?! Where did that come from?'%K%P
She sounded confused.%K%P
'You said you were curious, right?\nAbout having that many followers?'%K%P
'Well, what if you could experience all that\nfirst hand?'%K%P
'For...real?'%K%P
Akane raised an eyebrow.%K%P
I already knew it was useless trying to get her to\ndo anything she didn't want to do.%K%P
But maybe we could find something productive that\nAkane would also enjoy.%K%P
'And that's not all! You could get to wear all\nkinds of cute outfits, and fans would send you\ngifts and stuff.'%K%P
'Outfits...? Gifts...?'%K%P
'I'd help you out, of course. What do you say?\nIt's worth a try, right?'%K%P
Akane's eyes widened in excitement.%K%P
'That sounds great! I bet being an idol is tons\nof fun! And if you're gonna help, it should\nbe a cinch! Let's do it!'%K%P
All right, I finally managed to get her motivated\nabout something!%K%P
This was gonna work, I just knew it.%K%P
'Wait just one moment.\nAkane, an idol?\nAre you serious?'%K%P
Inori brought us back down a notch.%K%P
'She can't sing or dance, and fancy stage outfits\nwould be wasted on her, don't you think?'%K%P
'Jeez, what's your problem, Inori?!'%K%P
'I'm simply voicing my opinion.'%K%P
'Next time keep it to yourself!'%K%P
'Whoa, time out! Flying off the handle like that\nisn't going to win you any fans.'%K%P
I did my best to calm Akane down before things\nescalated again.%K%P
'Come on, give me a smile.'%K%P
'We'll take things one step at a time.\nLet's start by trying to curb your temper.\nHow's that sound?'%K%P
'Urrrgh... Okay, I guess.\nA little at a time, that'll be easy!'%K%P
Akane's anger disappeared and her face\nbroke into a smile.%K%P
I think we dodged a bullet there.%K%P
'Okay, what's next...? I guess you should learn a\nlittle more about human society.'%K%P
'If you're gonna attract fans, you need to be able\nto empathize with them.'%K%P
'You're right... How about you teach me, Sho?'%K%P
'I'll bet I can learn a lot from observing\nyour lifestyle!'%K%P
'Sure. I'll do my best to support you from now on.'%K%P
'I am so psyched! This is gonna be awesome!'%K%P
Akane had thrown off her lethargy and was\nnow raring to go.%K%P
'Were you trying to rile her up on purpose...?'%K%P
After Akane dashed out of the room, I confronted\nInori over her objections.%K%P
They had sounded a little staged, somehow.%K%P
'Anyone would get mad at you for saying that kind\nof stuff, not just Akane.'%K%P
'I'm sorry. I just wanted to make it clear that\nshe's going to have to reign in her emotions,\nespecially her anger.'%K%P
Inori was prepared to offend Akane if it meant\nhelping to reform her in the long run.\nThat was so like her.%K%P
'You didn't have to set yourself up as the bad guy.'%K%P
Her dedication was admirable, but it was going a\nlittle far to try and shoulder all the responsibility\nherself.%K%P
I wouldn't want to drive a wedge between the\ntwo goddesses, even if it was for Akane's sake.%K%P
'I know rehabilitating Akane is important,\nbut don't forget we're in this together.'%K%P
'Heehee, I suppose you're right.\nI got carried away.'%K%P
'Thank you for your concern, Sho.'%K%P
Inori favored me with a bright smile and\na graceful bow.%K%P
That settled that.%K%P
'Do you think your boss will go for this plan?'%K%P
'Hm... To be honest, I can never really predict how\nshe'll react to anything.'%K%P
'I'll have to go run it by her first.'%K%P
We had to try. For the time being, that was all\nwe could do.%K%P
'Thanks. I'll leave that part up to you.'%K%P
Our strategy meeting ended, this time with the\ndecision to center Akane's rehabilitation around an\nidol career, pending approval from the higher ups.%K%P
For all we know, they might still shoot down\nthe idea.%K%P
My heart pounded while I waited for\nInori to get back.%K%P
She finally did a few hours later.%K%P
'I'm back.'%K%P
'Hey, Inori.\nHow did it go?'%K%P
'Well... We got the go-ahead.'%K%P
From what she'd said before, I'd thought our\nproposal had a pretty high chance of being rejected.\nI was surprised it got approved so easily.%K%P
We weren't even given any special conditions\nto work under.%K%P
It was kind of an anti-climax, but I was glad we\ncould proceed as planned.%K%P
Tomorrow we'd officially start work on\nAkane's rehabilitation.%K%P
'Woohoo! This'll be a blast!'%K%P
